item.title: Erosion of surface leading to tyres slipping, 7th February
item.description:
The surface at the top of Gambles Lane is being eroded and vehicles with trailers, heavy lorries, vans and cars are unable to ascend the hill (25% slope) or pass vehicles coming the other way. Tyres are slipping and clutches being burnt out. Utter Chaos !! W3W ///modifies.retained.cloud

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep rut on edge of Gambles Lane, eroding highway, 7th February
item.description:
Deep rut at edge of road at a steep and one of the crucial passing points on Gambles Lane, and eroding the highway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard missing, 7th February
item.description:
Since New Road has been closed, the bollard opposite Highbank's gate has been progressively knocked over and has now disappeared, and can be found on the opposite side of the road down the lane, near to Markhuset. W3W ///hazelnuts.watches.scariest

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Multiple bollards damaged on Gambles Lane, 7th February
item.description:
Multiple bollards damaged on Gambles Lane which is now very dangerous to road users. the bollards are there to show that there is a three foot ditch within 12 inches of the bollard. One of the photos shows a tyre track demonstrating how close vehicles are to the ditch. the Gambles Lane was designed for horse, carts and pedestrians, not 7-tonne lorries which now use it as shortcut. There is nowhere for vehicles to pass safely. W3W ///lectured.anthems.gateway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Complete bollard is damaged (Non illuminating bollard or post)

item.title: Potholes in the road, 7th February
item.description:

item.title: Two very deep potholes an the edge of the highway, 7th February
item.description:
Two Large and deep potholes in Gambles Lane caused by heavy traffic following ongoing closure of New Road and continually being made bigger due to water flowing down the lane causing erosion of the highway. Located just outside the gates to Hillside Cottage What 3 Words ///steam.receive.shrubbery

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Blocked ditch causing excess runoff onto Gambles Lane, 7th February
item.description:
This has been an issue for over 5 years. Each year we have been promised it will be resolved, but again it remains an issue causing damage to the highway and a hazard when it is icy.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes on Gambles Lane, 7th February
item.description:
Two Large and deep potholes in Gambles Lane in the narrowest part which is very difficult to avoid, caused by heavy traffic following ongoing closure of New Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Large and deep pothole on the edge of the road, 7th February
item.description:
Large and deep pothole on the edge of the narrowest part of Gambles Lane which has progressively become deeper causing drivers to ground their vehicle. My son has recently had to repair his mini due to the front suspension breaking, flat tyre and buckled front wheel. We live up this lane so have no choice but two use it !! What 3 Words - ///blissful.grownup.interview

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gambles Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
